text: For people complaining, here’s some examples of what DEIA actually is. Trainings to prevent sexual harassment in the workplace are part of DEI initiatives. Pay transparency laws are the result of DEI initiatives. Requiring wheel chair ramps and closed … See more

To all you who know better, but want to act a fool. DEI in food terms. You want a store that only sells fresh oranges. Costco is in the DEI business, so they sell fresh oranges, fresh apples, fresh bananas, fresh pears, fresh tomatoes, fresh cucumbers, fresh spinach leaves, fresh pineapples and other fresh produce. The two key parts of my analogy comparing the fruits to DEI, is that Costco offers it’s customers different types of fruits, but they all have one thing in common…all of the different fruits are selected based on the same qualification/ standard…FRESH. Different fruits, yet same high standards for being selected. You’re welcome.

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion. This is what DEI is. "Diversity" is more important than qualifications. "Equity" (same outcomes) is more important than merit. "Inclusion" is more important than customer service. So, for DEI doctrine, Costco would hire a black transgender person with no skills or qualifications and pay him the same wage as a white man with qualifications oozing from his pores. DEI isn't about equality, it's about segregation, subjugation, and unfairness. It will cost Costco its company.
it's pretty much written down in black and white, so anybody that knows how to reconfigure it out pretty quickly. It's the same as affirmative action basically

- DEI simply means that that an employer will hire employees that are different in backgrounds, but still have the same level of expertise as their employees at their same position. Stop trying to act as if Costco is not hiring qualified employees. They are. They just don’t all look alike or live the same lifestyle like you and me. Get over yourself.
